main_definition: To revoke or annul a previously arranged event, agreement, or arrangement.

meanings_and_examples.definition: A rescheduled or postponed event due to unforeseen circumstances
meanings_and_examples.example: The concert was cancelled due to severe weather conditions.

meanings_and_examples.definition: The termination of a service, subscription, or membership agreement
meanings_and_examples.example: I accidentally clicked the 'cancel' button on my streaming account and lost access to all shows.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Rejecting or refusing something that was previously agreed upon
meanings_and_examples.example: When they found out about his dishonesty, their dinner plans were cancelled.

meanings_and_examples.definition: An agreement to terminate a contractual obligation before its due date
meanings_and_examples.example: The parties mutually decided to cancel the lease agreement after discovering major defects in the property.
